pullsbody:
Fixes #31


As of January 1 2019, Mozilla requires that all GitHub projects include this [CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md](https://github.com/mozilla/repo-templates/blob/master/templates/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) file in the project root. The file has two parts:

1. Required Text - All text under the headings *Community Participation Guidelines and How to Report*, are required, and should not be altered.
2. Optional Text - The Project Specific Etiquette heading provides a space to speak more specifically about ways people can work effectively and inclusively together. Some examples of those can be found on the [Firefox Debugger](https://github.com/devtools-html/debugger.html/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) project, and [Common Voice](https://github.com/mozilla/voice-web/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md). (The optional part is commented out in the [raw template file](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/mozilla/repo-templates/blob/master/templates/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md), and will not be visible until you modify and uncomment that part.)

If you have any questions about this file, or Code of Conduct policies and procedures, please see [Mozilla-GitHub-Standards](https://wiki.mozilla.org/GitHub/Repository_Requirements) or email Mozilla-GitHub-Standards+CoC@mozilla.com.

_(Message COC002)_
pull_repo_desc: Runner is a project that manages starting tasks in a defined order. If tasks fail, the chain can be retried, or halted.
pull_commit_message:
Add Mozilla Code of Conduct file

Fixes #31.

_(Message COC002)_

pulltitle: Bug 1144445 - Add jitter to runner retries
pullsbody:
If large numbers of machines use runner, and begin retrying, this decreases their chances
of sychronizing and doing bad things (like DDoS services).
pull_repo_desc: Runner is a project that manages starting tasks in a defined order. If tasks fail, the chain can be retried, or halted.

pulltitle: Run the halt task when max attempts are reached on a failing task
pullsbody: This is the only sensible way to handle recurring failure on a machine with runner in an infinite loop (its intended use case).

pulltitle: Bug 1055794 - Allows explicit setting of an interpreter for running task...
pullsbody:
...s

On non-posix platforms (such as Windows) hashbangs are not necessarily obeyed. As such,
in order to launch runner from a native shell (such as cmd.exe) it is necessary
to set the interpreter explicitly in runner's task Popen command. These changes
allow each task to be configured with an explicit interpreter, or, for a global
interpreter to be set for all tasks.
pull_repo_desc: Runner is a project that manages starting tasks in a defined order. If tasks fail, the chain can be retried, or halted.
pull_commit_message:
Bug 1055794 - Allows explicit setting of an interpreter for running tasks

On non-posix platforms (such as Windows) hashbangs are not necessarily obeyed. As such,
in order to launch runner from a native shell (such as cmd.exe) it is necessary
to set the interpreter explicitly in runner's task Popen command. These changes
allow each task to be configured with an explicit interpreter, or, for a global
interpreter to be set for all tasks.

pulltitle: Bug 1093773 - Start on-demand instances using golden AMIs.
pullsbody:
Shut down on-demand instances will work because they are launched with
instance_initiated_shutdown_behavior set to "terminate".
pull_repo_desc: Runner is a project that manages starting tasks in a defined order. If tasks fail, the chain can be retried, or halted.
pull_commit_message:
Bug 1093773 - Start on-demand instances using golden AMIs.

Shut down on-demand instances will work because they are launched with
instance_initiated_shutdown_behavior set to "terminate".
